title: rclone with --sftp-ssh option still checks for SSH_AUTH_SOCK
body:
<!--

We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

**STOP and READ**
**YOUR POST WILL BE REMOVED IF IT IS LOW QUALITY**:
Please show the effort you've put into solving the problem and please be specific.
People are volunteering their time to help! Low effort posts are not likely to get good answers!

If you think you might have found a bug, try to replicate it with the latest beta (or stable).
The update instructions are available at https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_selfupdate/

If you can still replicate it or just got a question then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

for a quick response instead of filing an issue on this repo.

If nothing else helps, then please fill in the info below which helps us help you.

**DO NOT REDACT** any information except passwords/keys/personal info.

You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.

Make sure to include a log obtained with '-vv'.

You can also use '-vv --log-file bug.log' and a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
I am using the new --sftp-ssh option (on a system where we use HostbasedAuthentication, which isn't supported by the inbuilt ssh client). However, while the ssh command itself works without SSH_AUTH_SOCK set, rclone aborts with the message
Failed to create file system for "systemname:/": couldn't connect to ssh-agent: SSH agent requested but SSH_AUTH_SOCK not-specified
Which shouldn't be relevant in the case that external ssh is used.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone v1.64.0-DEV
- os/version: rocky 9.2 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 5.14.0-284.18.1.el9_2.x86_64 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.20.4
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
rocky linux 9.2 64bit


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
sftp


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone --sftp-ssh "ssh user@mysystem" lsd mysystem:/


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
$ rclone -vv --sftp-ssh "ssh user@mysystem" lsd mysystem:/
2023/08/18 16:34:17 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.64.0-DEV" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "--sftp-ssh" "ssh user@mysystem" "lsd" "mysystem:/"]
2023/08/18 16:34:17 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "mysystem:/"
2023/08/18 16:34:17 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/xxxx/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2023/08/18 16:34:17 DEBUG : mysystem: detected overridden config - adding "{AkS2u}" suffix to name
2023/08/18 16:34:17 NOTICE: mysystem{AkS2u}: --sftp-ssh is in use - ignoring user/host/port from config - set in the parameters to --sftp-ssh (remove them from the config to silence this warning)
2023/08/18 16:34:17 Failed to create file system for "mysystem:/": couldn't connect to ssh-agent: SSH agent requested but SSH_AUTH_SOCK not-specified


```

Contents of /home/xxxx/.config/rclone/rclone.conf:
```
[mysystem]
type = sftp
shell_type = unix
```

I'd note that the NOTICE about **ignoring user/host/port from config (remove them from the config to silence this warning)** seems to be triggered regardless of what is actually in the config file since it contains none of those parameters.

<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.
